sentences.chinese: 摆在议会面前的提案包括建立两个特殊法庭专门审理暴力犯罪案件。

detailed_translations.english: an institution that has the power to make or change laws

name: rebellious
trans: adj. 反抗的；造反的；难控制的

sentences.english: rebellious teenagers
sentences.chinese: 叛逆的青少年

sentences.english: He’s always had a rebellious streak (= a tendency to rebel ) .
sentences.chinese: 他向来个性叛逆。

detailed_translations.chinese: 反抗的；造反的；难控制的
detailed_translations.english: deliberately not obeying people in authority or rules of behaviour

name: desolate
trans: adj. 荒凉的；无人烟的 vt. 使荒凉；使孤寂

sentences.english: a desolate landscape
sentences.chinese: 荒凉的景色

detailed_translations.english: a place that is desolate is empty and looks sad because there are no people there
a place that is desolate is empty and looks sad because there are no people there
someone who is desolate feels very sad and lonely

name: fortify
trans: vt. 加强；增强；（酒）的酒精含量；设防于 vi. 筑防御工事

sentences.english: Her position was fortified by election successes and economic recovery.
sentences.chinese: 她的地位因为选举获胜及经济复苏而得到巩固。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage an attitude or feeling and make it stronger
to build towers, walls etc around an area or city in order to defend it

name: prospect
trans: n. 前途；预期；景色 vi. 勘探，找矿 vt. 勘探，勘察

sentences.english: The prospect of marriage terrified Alice.
sentences.chinese: 想到要结婚，艾丽斯害怕极了。

sentences.english: I had no job, no education, and no prospects .
sentences.chinese: 我没有工作，没受过什么教育，前途渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: a particular event which will probably or definitely happen in the future – used especially when you want to talk about how you feel about it

name: provisions
trans: n. 规定（provision的复数）；食品；预备 v. 供应补给品；供应粮食（provision的三单形式）

name: resolve
trans: vt. 决定；溶解；使…分解；决心要做… vi. 解决；决心；分解 n. 坚决；决定要做的事

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

name: ceremonial
trans: adj. 仪式的；正式的，礼仪的 n. 仪式，礼节

sentences.english: the Mayor’s ceremonial duties
sentences.chinese: 市长的礼仪职责

sentences.english: Native American ceremonial robes
sentences.chinese: 美洲印第安人的礼袍

detailed_translations.english: used in a ceremony or done as part of a ceremony
a special ceremony, or special formal actions

name: megalith
trans: n. 巨石

name: Neolithic
trans: adj. [古] 新石器时代的；早先的

sentences.english: a Neolithic burial ground
sentences.chinese: 一块新石器时代的墓地

detailed_translations.english: relating to the last period of the stone age, about 10,000 years ago, when people began to live together in small groups and make stone tools and weapons

name: restore
trans: vt. 恢复；修复；归还 vi. 恢复；还原

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

name: interdependent
trans: adj. 相互依赖的；互助的

sentences.english: countries with interdependent economies
sentences.chinese: 经济上相互依赖的国家

detailed_translations.english: depending on or necessary to each other

name: parasite
trans: n. 寄生虫；食客

sentences.english: Kangaroos harbour a vast range of parasites.
sentences.chinese: 袋鼠身上有各种各样的寄生虫。

detailed_translations.english: a plant or animal that lives on or in another plant or animal and gets food from it

name: refuge
trans: n. 避难；避难所；庇护 vt. 给予…庇护；接纳…避难 vi. 避难；逃避

sentences.english: a wildlife refuge
sentences.chinese: 野生动物保护区

detailed_translations.english: shelter or protection from someone or something

name: symbiotic
trans: adj. [生态] 共生的；共栖的

sentences.english: ...fungi that have a symbiotic relationship with the trees of these northwestern forests.
sentences.chinese: ...与这些位于西北部的森林里的树木存在共生关系的真菌。

detailed_translations.english: a symbiotic relationship is one in which the people, organizations, or living things involved depend on each other

name: Islamic
trans: adj. 伊斯兰教的；穆斯林的

name: mausoleum
trans: n. 陵墓；阴森森的大厦

name: memorial
trans: n. 纪念碑，纪念馆；纪念仪式；纪念物 adj. 记忆的；纪念的，追悼的

sentences.english: A memorial service is being held for her at St. Paul's Church.
sentences.chinese: 一场为她举行的纪念仪式正在圣保罗教堂举行。

sentences.english: The hospital was built as a memorial to King Edward VII.
sentences.chinese: 该医院是为了纪念国王爱德华七世而建的。

detailed_translations.english: done or made in order to remind people of someone who has died
something, especially a stone with writing on it, that reminds people of someone who has died

name: symmetrical
trans: adj. 匀称的，对称的

sentences.english: The pattern was perfectly symmetrical.
sentences.chinese: 该图案完全对称。

detailed_translations.english: an object or design that is symmetrical has two halves that are exactly the same shape and size

name: align
trans: vt. 使结盟；使成一行；匹配 vi. 排列；排成一行

sentences.english: The desks were neatly aligned in rows.
sentences.chinese: 书桌一行行排得整整齐齐。

sentences.english: Make sure that all the holes align.
sentences.chinese: 确保所有的洞眼成一条直线。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange things so that they form a line or are parallel to each other, or to be in a position that forms a line etc

name: excavation
trans: n. 挖掘，发掘

sentences.english: A second excavation, in 1985, lasted a year and was cut short for technical reasons.
sentences.chinese: 第二次挖掘是在1985年，因为技术原因持续了一年就突然停止了。

sentences.english: If he thinks I’m particular about excavation records, you should see him taking pictures!
sentences.chinese: 如果他觉得我对挖掘纪录很挑剔，你应该看看他是怎么拍照的。

sentences.english: Blue flags define the excavation perimeter, while yellow ones mark the location of fossils or stone tools.
sentences.chinese: 蓝旗用来显示发掘地的周长，而黄旗用来标明发掘出化石或石制工具的地点。

name: rebellion
trans: n. 叛乱；反抗；谋反；不服从

sentences.english: an armed rebellion
sentences.chinese: 武装叛乱

detailed_translations.english: an organized attempt to change the government or leader of a country, using violence

name: eerie
trans: adj. 可怕的；怪异的

sentences.english: the eerie sound of an owl hooting at night
sentences.chinese: 夜间猫头鹰那怪异恐怖的叫声

detailed_translations.english: strange and frightening

name: intrude
trans: vt. 把…强加；把…硬挤 vi. 闯入；侵入；侵扰

sentences.english: The press has been blamed for intruding into people's personal lives in an unacceptable way.
sentences.chinese: 新闻媒体因以一种令人无法接受的方式侵入人们的私生活而受到谴责。

detailed_translations.english: to come into a place or situation, and have an unwanted effect

name: skirmish
trans: n. 小冲突，小规模战斗；小争论 vi. 进行小规模战斗；发生小争论

sentences.english: Border skirmishes between India and Pakistan were common.
sentences.chinese: 印巴边境的小冲突曾经是常有的事。

sentences.english: They were skirmishing close to the minefield now.
sentences.chinese: 他们当时正在雷区附近小规模交火。

detailed_translations.chinese: 小冲突，小规模战斗；小争论
detailed_translations.english: a fight between small groups of soldiers, ships etc, especially one that happens away from the main part of a battle – used in news reports

detailed_translations.chinese: 进行小规模战斗；发生小争论
detailed_translations.english: If people skirmish, they fight

name: adversary
trans: n. 对手；敌手

sentences.english: His business rivals knew they could expect no quarter from such a ruthless adversary.
sentences.chinese: 他的业务对手都知道他们不能指望这样无情的对手的慈悲。

sentences.english: They tell us, sir, that we are weak -- unable to cope with so formidable an adversary.
sentences.chinese: 先生，他们告诉我们，我们是弱小的——不能应付如此强大的对手。

sentences.english: If we use exponentiation to encrypt or decrypt , the adversary can use logarithm to attack .
sentences.chinese: 如果我们运用求幂运算来加密和解密，对手就可以运用对数进行攻击。

detailed_translations.english: a country or person you are fighting or competing against

name: bohemian
trans: adj. 波希米亚的；放荡不羁的；波希米亚语的 n. 波希米亚人；波希米亚语；放浪者

name: exterminate
trans: vt. 消灭；根除

sentences.english: Staff use the poison to exterminate moles and rabbits.
sentences.chinese: 员工用毒药来消灭鼹鼠和野兔。

detailed_translations.english: to kill large numbers of people or animals of a particular type so that they no longer exist

name: grievance
trans: n. 不满，不平；委屈；冤情

sentences.english: anyone who has a legitimate grievance against the company
sentences.chinese: 凡是有正当理由对公司感到不满的人

sentences.english: a means of overcoming genuine grievances
sentences.chinese: 化解委屈的一个办法

sentences.english: There must be an opportunity for both sides to air their grievances .
sentences.chinese: 一定要有一个机会让双方都说出心中的不满。

sentences.english: The teachers’ contract established a grievance procedure .
sentences.chinese: 教师合同建立了一个申诉程序。

sentences.english: the sense of grievance which characterized him as a young man
sentences.chinese: 他年轻时惯有的不满情绪

detailed_translations.english: a belief that you have been treated unfairly, or an unfair situation or event that affects and upsets you

name: overcredulous
trans: 太容易相信的

name: vanquish
trans: vt. 征服；击败；克服；抑制（感情等）

sentences.english: A happy ending is only possible because the hero has first vanquished the dragons.
sentences.chinese: 只有主人公先把那些恶龙制服，快乐的结局才有可能。

detailed_translations.english: to defeat someone or something completely

name: combatant
trans: n. 战士；争斗者 adj. 战斗的；好斗的

sentences.english: I have never suggested that U.N. forces could physically separate the combatants in the region.
sentences.chinese: 我从未表示过联合国部队能将该地区的参战者们实际隔离开。

detailed_translations.english: someone who fights in a war

name: expectant
trans: adj. 期待的；怀孕的；预期中的 n. 期待者；候选人

sentences.english: a row of expectant faces
sentences.chinese: 一张张满怀期待的面孔

detailed_translations.chinese: 期待的；怀孕的；预期中的
detailed_translations.english: hopeful that something good or exciting will happen, or showing this

name: feint
trans: n. 佯攻；伪装 vi. 佯攻；假装 vt. 佯攻 adj. 假的

sentences.english: I feinted to the left, then to the right.
sentences.chinese: 我佯装要攻到左方，然后再到右方。

detailed_translations.english: a movement or an attack that is intended to deceive an opponent, especially in  boxing
to pretend to hit someone in  boxing

name: gallant
trans: adj. 英勇的，勇敢的；华丽的；雄伟的 n. (Gallant)人名；(法)加朗；(英)加伦特

sentences.english: a gallant attempt to save lives
sentences.chinese: 救人的勇敢之举

detailed_translations.chinese: 英勇的，勇敢的；华丽的；雄伟的
detailed_translations.english: brave

name: repentant
trans: adj. 悔改的；后悔的

sentences.english: He was feeling guilty and depressed, repentant and scared.
sentences.chinese: 他现在觉得既内疚又沮丧，既悔恨又害怕。

detailed_translations.english: sorry for something wrong that you have done

name: spar
trans: n. [矿物] 晶石；圆材（如桅、桁等）；争论；拳斗 vi. 争论；拳击 vt. 装圆材于 n. (Spar)人名；(德)施帕尔；(法)斯帕尔

sentences.english: He entered the ring to spar a few one-minute rounds with an old friend.
sentences.chinese: 他进了拳击场与一个老朋友练了几个一分钟回合的轻拳出击。

detailed_translations.chinese: [矿物] 晶石；圆材（如桅、桁等）；争论；拳斗
detailed_translations.english: a thick pole, especially one used on a ship to support sails or ropes
to practise  boxing  with someone

name: imperial
trans: adj. 帝国的；皇帝的；至高无上的；威严的 n. 纸张尺寸；特等品 n. (Imperial)人名；(西)因佩里亚尔

sentences.english: Britain’s imperial expansion in the 19th century
sentences.chinese: 19世纪英帝国的扩张

detailed_translations.english: relating to an empire or to the person who rules it

name: kimono
trans: n. 和服

name: picturesque
trans: adj. 独特的；生动的；别致的；图画般的

sentences.english: a quiet fishing village with a picturesque harbour
sentences.chinese: 拥有一座美丽港口的宁静渔村

detailed_translations.english: a picturesque place is pretty and interesting in an old-fashioned way

name: Shinto
trans: n. (Shinto) （美、印、英）盛特（人名）

name: shogun
trans: n. （日）幕府时代的将军，幕府的首领

name: discrimination
trans: n. 歧视；区别，辨别；识别力

sentences.english: laws to prevent discrimination
sentences.chinese: 防止歧视的法律

sentences.english: shape discrimination
sentences.chinese: 形状识别力

detailed_translations.english: the practice of treating one person or group differently from another in an unfair way

name: foremen
trans: [经管] 工长 工头

name: immigrant
trans: adj. 移民的；迁入的 n. 移民，侨民

sentences.english: an illegal immigrant
sentences.chinese: 非法移民

sentences.english: a new wave of immigrants from the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 来自中东的一股新兴的移民浪潮

detailed_translations.english: someone who enters another country to live there permanently

name: laborer
trans: n. 劳动者；工人

sentences.english: Traditionally cut blue jeans carry a whiff of the laborer about them, so denim on a leader suggests a willingness to roll up the sleeves and dig in.
sentences.chinese: 传统剪裁的蓝色牛仔裤带有一种劳动者的气息，因此领导者穿着仔裤可以表达一种愿意卷起袖子大干一场的意思。

sentences.english: It is no use offering the manual laborer, tired out with a hard week’s sweat and effort, the chance of playing a game of football or baseball on Saturday afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 对于那些体力劳动者来说，一周辛苦的工作使他们精疾力竭，因此在周六下午给他们提供踢足球或者打棒球的机会是没有意义的。

sentences.english: Basically, in 2009, the life of a wage laborer has the same essential features in every corner of the globe.
sentences.chinese: 在2009年，工资劳动者的生活，其基本特征在全球的各个角落都是大致相同的。

name: veteran
trans: n. 老兵；老手；富有经验的人；老运动员 adj. 经验丰富的；老兵的

sentences.english: He is a veteran of the last revolution in medical technology, gene therapy, which, after some hyped expectations in the 1990s, fell into disfavor after some unsuccessful trials.
sentences.chinese: 他是基因治疗这项最新医学技术的老手，经过了1990年代的兴奋期和之后几次失败的实验后，基因治疗技术已经失宠了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been a soldier, sailor etc in a war

name: archaeological
trans: adj. [古] 考古学的；[古] 考古学上的

sentences.english: Just who made the tools is unclear from the archaeological evidence alone, though our relative Homo erectus is identified as the likely creator of at least the Acheulian tools.
sentences.chinese: 尽管已经确定我们的近亲直立人至少是阿舍利工具可能的创造者，但仅凭考古学证据还无法确定是谁制造了这些工具。

sentences.english: So there are two other models, then, models different from the immigration model, two other models for understanding the formation of Israel, that build on this archaeological evidence.
sentences.chinese: 那么还有两个其他的模型，与移民模型不同的两个模型，这两个模型也是为了说明以色列的形成，它们是依据考古学证据。

sentences.english: The work fills (in) a gap which has hitherto existed in our archaeological literature.
sentences.chinese: 这部著作填补了我国考古学文献中的一个空白。

name: blog
trans: n. 网络日志，博客 v. 写博客

sentences.english: When Barbieux started his blog, his aspirations were small; he simply hoped to communicate with a few people.
sentences.chinese: 当巴布开始他的博客时，他的期望并不大。他只是希望能与几个人交流。

detailed_translations.english: a web page containing information or opinions from a particular person or about a particular subject, to which new information is added regularly

name: expedition
trans: n. 远征；探险队；迅速

sentences.english: an expedition to the North Pole
sentences.chinese: 北极探险

sentences.english: another Qomolangma expedition
sentences.chinese: 又一次珠穆朗玛峰探险

detailed_translations.english: a long and carefully organized journey, especially to a dangerous or unfamiliar place, or the people that make this journey

name: submersible
trans: adj. 能潜水的；能沉入水中的

name: preamble
trans: n. （法规、契约的）序言，绪论；前言，开场白 v. 作序文

sentences.english: The controversy has arisen over the text of the preamble to the unification treaty.
sentences.chinese: 就统一条约的序文措词出现了争论。

detailed_translations.english: A preamble is an introduction that comes before something you say or write

name: repeal
trans: vt. 废除，废止，撤销（法律、议会法案）；放弃；否定 n. 废除，撤销

sentences.english: The government has just repealed the law segregating public facilities.
sentences.chinese: 政府刚刚废除了隔离公共设施的法令。

sentences.english: Next year will be the 60th anniversary of the repeal of Prohibition.
sentences.chinese: 明年将是禁酒令废止的60周年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 废除；撤销；废止；放弃；否定
detailed_translations.english: if a government repeals a law, it officially ends that law
Repeal is also a noun

name: advisor
trans: n. 顾问；指导教师；劝告者

sentences.english: This is the role of the coach, advisor, or teacher.
sentences.chinese: 这就是教练、顾问或者老师所扮演的角色。

sentences.english: When you purchase stocks, or equities, as your advisor might put it, you become a part owner of the business.
sentences.chinese: 当你买入股票或者等价物，你的顾问会告诉你说你已经成为了企业的部分所有者。

name: agency
trans: n. 代理，中介；代理处，经销处；作用

sentences.english: a UN agency responsible for helping refugees
sentences.chinese: 负责为难民提供帮助的联合国机构

sentences.english: the Environmental Protection Agency
sentences.chinese: 环保局

detailed_translations.english: an organization or department, especially within a government, that does a specific job

name: reliable
trans: adj. 可靠的；可信赖的 n. 可靠的人

sentences.english: a birth control method that is cheap and reliable
sentences.chinese: 既便宜又可靠的避孕方法

sentences.english: Miller was a quiet and reliable man.
sentences.chinese: 米勒是个话不多且可靠的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or depended on

name: transparency
trans: n. 透明，透明度；幻灯片；有图案的玻璃

sentences.english: ...transparencies of masterpieces from Lizzie's art collection.
sentences.chinese: …莉齐艺术收藏品中一些杰作的幻灯片。

detailed_translations.chinese: 透明，透明度；幻灯片；有图案的玻璃
detailed_translations.english: a sheet of plastic or a piece of photographic film through which light can be shone to show a picture on a large screen

name: diplomat
trans: n. 外交家，外交官；有外交手腕的人；处事圆滑机敏的人

sentences.english: French diplomats
sentences.chinese: 法国外交官

detailed_translations.english: someone who officially represents their government in a foreign country

name: humanitarian
trans: adj. 人道主义的；博爱的；基督凡人论的 n. 人道主义者；慈善家；博爱主义者；基督凡人论者

sentences.english: And on each of those issues we have said that we would consider that and, in fact, have provided some humanitarian support.
sentences.chinese: 对于每一件这样的事情，我们都说过，我们将会对此进行考虑，事实上，我们向他们提供了人道主义援助。

sentences.english: But part of trying to do what is right for the Burmese people is to provide humanitarian assistance in this time of extreme need.
sentences.chinese: 但是，对缅甸人民来说，正确的行动部分是为他们提供人道主义援助，而在目前这个时刻更是极端的需要”。

sentences.english: But otherwise, it is best left to the humanitarian experts, who will be there after you are gone and therefore need to preserve their independence and their impartiality.
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果不能，最好将这些任务留给人道主义专家，这些专家在部队撤退之后仍将留在那，因此需要保持他们的独立和公正。

name: international
trans: adj. 国际的；国际通用的 n. 国际体育比赛（选手）；外国人 n. (International) 共产国际（组织）

sentences.english: the response of the international community
sentences.chinese: 国际社会的反响

sentences.english: the UN and other international organizations
sentences.chinese: 联合国和其他国际组织

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving more than one nation

name: organization
trans: n. 组织；机构；体制；团体

sentences.english: The public expect high standards from any large organization.
sentences.chinese: 公众对任何大型机构都期望很高。

sentences.english: the World Trade Organization
sentences.chinese: 世界贸易组织

sentences.english: a voluntary organization which helps disabled people with their transport needs
sentences.chinese: 帮助残疾人士满足其交通需求的一个志愿组织

sentences.english: an illegal terrorist organization
sentences.chinese: 非法的恐怖组织

sentences.english: international organizations such as the UN
sentences.chinese: 诸如联合国之类的国际组织

detailed_translations.english: a group such as a club or business that has formed for a particular purpose

name: decompose
trans: vt. 分解；使腐烂 vi. 分解；腐烂

sentences.english: a partially decomposed body
sentences.chinese: 部分腐烂的尸体

detailed_translations.english: to decay or make something decay

name: dynasty
trans: n. 王朝，朝代

sentences.english: The Habsburg dynasty ruled in Austria from 1278 to 1918.
sentences.chinese: 哈布斯堡王朝在1278至1918年间统治奥地利。

detailed_translations.english: a family of kings or other rulers whose parents, grandparents etc have ruled the country for many years

name: hieroglyph
trans: n. 象形文字；图画文字；秘密符号

sentences.english: Initially the patterns I used were hieroglyph like symbols.
sentences.chinese: 我所采用的图案是类似符号的象形文字。

sentences.english: In the Late Period, the hieroglyph of the bird was used to represent this deity directly.
sentences.chinese: 在后来的时期内，鸟的象形文字直接用来表现神。

sentences.english: Initially the patterns I used were hieroglyph like symbols. After a holiday in the Maldives the "face" patterns developed. The local fishes gave me endless inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 我所采用的图案是类似符号的象形文字。在马尔代夫度假后，这些“脸”的图形开始发展。那里的鱼类给了我无穷无尽的灵感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 象形文字, 图画文字
detailed_translations.english: a picture or symbol used to represent a word or part of a word, especially in the ancient Egyptian writing system

name: mummified
trans: adj. 木乃伊化的 v. 木乃伊化（mummify的过去式）

name: sarcophagus
trans: n. （雕刻精美的）石棺；（古希腊人用来制石棺的）大理石

name: considerate
trans: adj. 体贴的；体谅的；考虑周到的

sentences.english: He was always kind and considerate.
sentences.chinese: 他总是很善良，为别人着想。

detailed_translations.english: always thinking of what other people need or want and being careful not to upset them

name: emancipated
trans: adj. 被解放的 v. 解放；使…获得自由（emancipate的过去分词）

name: entranced
trans: adj. 着迷的；狂喜的

name: etiquette
trans: n. 礼节，礼仪；规矩

sentences.english: strict rules of professional etiquette
sentences.chinese: 严格的行规

detailed_translations.english: the formal rules for polite behaviour in society or in a particular group

name: impromptu
trans: adj. 即兴的，即席的 n. 即兴曲；即席演出 adv. 即兴地，即席地

sentences.english: When do we make impromptu speeches?
sentences.chinese: 我们什么时候要做即席演讲？

sentences.english: When Marco was asked to give an impromptu speech on“Addictions,”he divided the topic /into/ several parts. Notice how he used the pattern of related subtopics in the outline that follows.
sentences.chinese: 举个例子，马可要做一个关于“嗜好”的即席演讲，他将这个主题分成了几部分，注意下面他在大纲中是如何运用有关联副主题模式的。

detailed_translations.english: done or said without any preparation or planning

name: punting
trans: n. 撑篙；踢空中球 v. 用篙撑（方头平底船）；踢悬空球（punt的ing形式）

name: assuage
trans: vt. 平息；缓和；减轻

sentences.english: Nothing could assuage his guilt.
sentences.chinese: 什么都不能减轻他的内疚。

detailed_translations.english: to make an unpleasant feeling less painful or severe

name: blithesome
trans: adj. 愉快的

sentences.english: She's self-confidence, talking relaxable and make others relaxable and blithesome, let you know life is so lively.
sentences.chinese: 她很自信，说话很放松也让别人放松、愉快，让人觉得生活充满希望。

detailed_translations.english: cheery; merry

name: caique
trans: n. 地中海轻帆船；轻巧小舟

name: epitome
trans: n. 缩影；摘要；象征

sentences.english: She looked the epitome of elegance.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去像是优雅的典范。

sentences.english: He was the very epitome of evil.
sentences.chinese: 他是邪恶的典型。

detailed_translations.english: the best possible example of something

name: listless
trans: adj. 倦怠的；无精打采的；百无聊赖的

sentences.english: The heat was making me listless.
sentences.chinese: 炎热的天气使我懒洋洋的。

detailed_translations.english: feeling tired and not interested in things

name: sonorous
trans: adj. 响亮的；作响的；能发出响亮声音的

sentences.english: a sonorous voice
sentences.chinese: 洪亮的嗓音

detailed_translations.chinese: 响亮的；作响的；能发出响亮声音的
detailed_translations.english: having a pleasantly deep loud sound

name: beseech
trans: vt. 恳求，哀求；乞求，急切地要求得到

sentences.english: She beseeched him to cut out his drinking and his smoking.
sentences.chinese: 她央求他戒酒戒烟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恳求，哀求；乞求，急切地要求得到
detailed_translations.english: to eagerly and anxiously ask someone for something

name: cajole
trans: vt. 以甜言蜜语哄骗；勾引

sentences.english: Do you think you can cajole some money out of your father?
sentences.chinese: 你认为你能从你父亲那里骗到一些钱吗?。

sentences.english: If a person often have lies flow and mouth, thus to cajole others, over time, he would lose the trust of the people.
sentences.chinese: 一个人如果经常有谎言流与口中，从而去哄骗他人，久而久之，他便会失去人们的信任。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually persuade someone to do something by being nice to them, or making promises to them

name: conceited
trans: adj. 自负的；狂想的；逞能的

sentences.english: You’re the most conceited, selfish person I’ve ever known.
sentences.chinese: 你是我认识的人当中最自负、最自私的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is conceited thinks they are very clever, skilful, beautiful etc – used to show disapproval

name: shirk
trans: vt. 逃避 vi. 推卸；逃避 n. (Shirk)人名；(英)舍克

sentences.english: He was fired for shirking.
sentences.chinese: 他因偷懒被解雇了。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately avoid doing something you should do, because you are lazy

name: conceit
trans: n. 自负；狂妄；幻想 vt. 幻想

sentences.english: The conceit of the woman!
sentences.chinese: 这个自负的女人！

detailed_translations.english: an attitude that shows you have too high an opinion of your own abilities or importance

name: fatal
trans: adj. 致命的；重大的；毁灭性的；命中注定的 n. (Fatal)人名；(葡、芬)法塔尔

sentences.english: potentially fatal diseases
sentences.chinese: 潜在致命的疾病

sentences.english: If it is not treated correctly, the condition can prove fatal (= be fatal ) .
sentences.chinese: 如果治疗不当，这种病可能会致命。

detailed_translations.english: resulting in someone’s death

name: intoxicate
trans: v. （酒或毒品）（使）麻醉；（使）中毒；（使）兴奋 adj. 喝醉的；陶醉的

detailed_translations.english: (of an alcoholic drink) to produce in (a person) a state ranging from euphoria to stupor, usually accompanied by loss of inhibitions and control; make drunk; inebriate

name: prudent
trans: adj. 谨慎的；精明的；节俭的 n. (Prudent)人名；(法)普吕当

sentences.english: prudent house buyers
sentences.chinese: 谨慎的购房者

detailed_translations.english: sensible and careful, especially by trying to avoid unnecessary risks

name: sentry
trans: n. 哨兵；岗哨 vi. 放哨 vt. 设岗哨

sentences.english: The sentry would not let her enter.
sentences.chinese: 警卫不会让她进来。

detailed_translations.english: a soldier standing outside a building as a guard

name: yarn
trans: n. 纱线；奇谈，故事 vt. 用纱线缠 vi. 讲故事

sentences.english: She still spins the yarn and knits sweaters for her family.
sentences.chinese: 她仍在为她的家人纺线织毛衣。

detailed_translations.english: thick thread made of cotton or wool, which is used to knit things

name: appease
trans: v. 使平息；使满足；使和缓；对……让步；安抚，安慰；绥靖；缓解（难受的感觉）；姑息

sentences.english: Gandhi was accused by some of trying to appease both factions of the electorate.
sentences.chinese: 甘地被一些人指责试图对两派选民都加以姑息。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使平息；使满足；使和缓；对…让步
detailed_translations.english: If you try to appease someone, you try to stop them from being angry by giving them what they want

name: contrive
trans: vt. 设计；发明；图谋 vi. 谋划；设法做到

sentences.english: In 1862, a technique was contrived to take a series of photographs showing stages of movement.
sentences.chinese: 1862年时发明了一种技术，可以拍出一连串展示连续动作的照片。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发明; 设计; 设法；造成
detailed_translations.english: to succeed in doing something in spite of difficulties

name: humbug
trans: n. 骗子；欺骗；谎话 vt. 欺骗；哄骗 vi. 行骗

sentences.english: He dismissed the prime minister’s comments as ‘pure humbug’.
sentences.chinese: 他对首相的评论不屑一顾，认为是“纯粹的假道学”。

detailed_translations.english: insincere or dishonest words or behaviour

name: subterfuge
trans: n. 托词；借口；诡计

sentences.english: Most people can see right through that type of subterfuge.
sentences.chinese: 大多数人一眼就能看穿这种遁词。

detailed_translations.english: a secret trick or slightly dishonest way of doing something, or the use of this

name: detestable
trans: adj. 可憎的，可恶的；嫌恶的

name: flustered
trans: adj. 慌张的；激动不安的 v. 慌张；混乱（fluster的过去式及过去分词形式）

sentences.english: Paul was looking flustered and embarrassed.
sentences.chinese: 保罗看上去神情慌乱，一脸窘迫。

sentences.english: I always get flustered in interviews.
sentences.chinese: 我面试时老是紧张。

detailed_translations.chinese: 慌张的， 激动不安的
detailed_translations.english: confused and nervous

name: haughty
trans: adj. 傲慢的；自大的

sentences.english: a haughty laugh
sentences.chinese: 傲慢的大笑

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a proud unfriendly way

name: portentous
trans: adj. 不祥的；预兆的；令人惊讶的

sentences.english: Recent developments are as portentous as the collapse of the Berlin Wall.
sentences.chinese: 最近的事态发展犹如柏林墙的倒塌，让人有一种山雨欲来风满楼的感觉。

detailed_translations.english: showing that something important is going to happen, especially something bad

name: vengeance
trans: n. 复仇；报复；报仇

sentences.english: a desire for vengeance
sentences.chinese: 复仇的愿望

sentences.english: a vow of vengeance
sentences.chinese: 复仇的誓言

sentences.english: an act of vengeance
sentences.chinese: 复仇的行为

detailed_translations.english: a violent or harmful action that someone does to punish someone for harming them or their family

name: volatile
trans: adj. [化学] 挥发性的；不稳定的；爆炸性的；反复无常的 n. 挥发物；有翅的动物 n. (Volatile)人名；(意)沃拉蒂莱

sentences.english: an increasingly volatile political situation
sentences.chinese: 日益动荡的政治局势

sentences.english: the highly volatile stock and bond markets
sentences.chinese: 相当不稳定的股票和债券市场

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 挥发性的；不稳定的；爆炸性的；反复无常的
detailed_translations.english: a volatile situation is likely to change suddenly and without warning

name: ancestral
trans: adj. 祖先的；祖传的

sentences.english: ...the family's ancestral home in southern Germany.
sentences.chinese: …这一家在德国南部的祖宅。

detailed_translations.english: You use ancestral to refer to a person's family in former times, especially when the family is important and has property or land that they have had for a long time

name: boisterous
trans: adj. 喧闹的；狂暴的；猛烈的

sentences.english: a class of boisterous five-year-olds
sentences.chinese: 一班活泼爱动的五岁孩子

detailed_translations.english: someone, especially a child, who is boisterous makes a lot of noise and has a lot of energy

name: carouse
trans: vi. 畅饮；欢宴 n. 喧闹的酒会或宴会；一饮而尽

sentences.english: They told him to stay home with his wife instead of going out and carousing with friends.
sentences.chinese: 他们告诉他与他的妻子在一起呆在家里，不要出去和朋友们一起痛饮狂欢。

detailed_translations.english: to drink a lot, be noisy, and have fun

detailed_translations.chinese: 喧闹的酒会或宴会；一饮而尽

name: mirth
trans: n. 欢笑；欢乐；高兴

sentences.english: Her body began to shake with mirth.
sentences.chinese: 她笑得浑身直颤。

detailed_translations.english: happiness and laughter

name: penitent
trans: adj. 忏悔的，悔过的 n. 悔罪者，忏悔者

sentences.english: a penitent expression
sentences.chinese: 愧疚的表情

detailed_translations.english: feeling sorry because you have done something wrong, and are intending not to do it again
someone who is doing  penance

name: unction
trans: n. 涂油；涂油礼；津津有味；虚情假意

name: amiable
trans: adj. 和蔼可亲的，亲切的 n. (Amiable)人名；(法)阿米亚布勒；(英)阿米娅布尔

sentences.english: The driver was an amiable young man.
sentences.chinese: 司机是位友善的年轻人。

sentences.english: She was in an amiable mood.
sentences.chinese: 她心情很好。

detailed_translations.english: friendly and easy to like

detailed_translations.chinese: (Amiable)人名；(法)阿米亚布勒；(英)阿米娅布尔

name: boastful
trans: adj. 自夸的；自负的；喜夸耀的

name: fad
trans: n. 时尚；一时的爱好；一时流行的狂热

sentences.english: Interest in organic food is not a fad, it’s here to stay.
sentences.chinese: 对有机食品的兴趣不是一时的风尚，它是长久的喜好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 时尚；一时的爱好；一时流行的狂热
detailed_translations.english: something that people like or do for a short time, or that is fashionable for a short time

name: rapturous
trans: adj. 狂喜的；兴高采烈的；欢天喜地的

name: incredulous
trans: adj. 怀疑的；不轻信的

sentences.english: ‘You sold the car?’ she asked, incredulous.
sentences.chinese: “你把车卖了？”她难以置信地问道。

detailed_translations.english: unable or unwilling to believe something

name: invincible
trans: adj. 无敌的；不能征服的

sentences.english: an invincible army
sentences.chinese: 无敌的军队

sentences.english: Young athletes think of themselves as invincible.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的运动员自认为是战无不胜的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能征服的， 无敌的
detailed_translations.english: too strong to be destroyed or defeated

name: persistence
trans: n. 持续；固执；存留；坚持不懈；毅力

sentences.english: Her persistence paid off when she was offered the job of manager.
sentences.chinese: 她得到了经理的职位，不懈坚持终于有了回报。

sentences.english: ‘Why can’t I come?’ repeated Will with dogged persistence .
sentences.chinese: “我为什么不能去？”威尔不死心地又问了一遍。

detailed_translations.english: determination to do something even though it is difficult or other people oppose it

name: resolution
trans: n. [物] 分辨率；决议；解决；决心

sentences.english: Then, with sudden resolution, she stood up.
sentences.chinese: 然后，她突然很坚决地站了起来。

sentences.english: She made a resolution to visit her relatives more often.
sentences.chinese: 她决定要多走走亲戚。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being resolute or determined

name: valorous
trans: adj. 勇敢的；勇武的

sentences.english: Seed your tears deep in your heart it will grow up to valorous flowers.
sentences.chinese: 把眼泪种在心里，会开出勇敢的花朵。

sentences.english: "Her passengers, the other hostages, will never forget her calm, confident, valorous work" (William W. Bradley).
sentences.chinese: “她的乘客，其他人质，永远不会忘记她冷静的、自信的、勇敢的举动” （威廉·W·布拉德利）。

sentences.english: Griffin - Sets forth the property of a valorous soldier whose magnanimity is such that he will dare all dangers, and even death itself, rather than become captive.
sentences.chinese: 狮鹫-出征的勇士以其无畏的精神敢于对抗一切危险，宁愿阵亡也决不被生俘。

name: verdant
trans: adj. 青翠的；翠绿的；没有经验的；不老练的 n. (Verdant)人名；(法)韦尔当

sentences.english: verdant fields
sentences.chinese: 葱茏的田野

detailed_translations.chinese: 青翠的；翠绿的；没有经验的；不老练的

name: asperity
trans: n. （表面的）粗糙；（气候等的）严酷；艰苦的条件；（性格）粗暴

sentences.english: "I told you Preskel had no idea," remarked Kemp with some asperity.
sentences.chinese: "我跟你说过普瑞克一无所知"，坎普有点儿不耐烦地说。

detailed_translations.chinese: （表面的）粗糙；（气候等的）严酷；艰苦的条件；（性格）粗暴
detailed_translations.english: if you speak with asperity, you say something in a way that is rough or severe, showing that you are feeling impatient

name: famished
trans: adj. 极饥饿的 v. 使饥饿（famish的过去式）

name: perished
trans: v. 死亡；毁灭；（橡胶等）老化；（使）虚弱（perish 的过去式及过去分词） adj. （人、身体部位等）冰冷的

name: repast
trans: n. 就餐，饮食 vi. 就餐；设宴

name: strenuous
trans: adj. 紧张的；费力的；奋发的；艰苦的；热烈的

sentences.english: a strenuous climb
sentences.chinese: 艰难的攀登

sentences.english: The doctor advised Ken to avoid strenuous exercise.
sentences.chinese: 医生建议肯避免剧烈运动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 紧张的；费力的；奋发的；艰苦的；热烈的
detailed_translations.english: needing a lot of effort or strength

name: doleful
trans: adj. 寂寞的；悲哀的；阴沉的；忧郁的

sentences.english: a doleful song about lost love
sentences.chinese: 一首关于逝去的爱情的哀歌

detailed_translations.chinese: 寂寞的；悲哀的；阴沉的；忧郁的
detailed_translations.english: very sad

name: expatiate
trans: vi. 详述；细说；漫游

sentences.english: I'm in such a drive that I can't expatiate.
sentences.chinese: 我的时间实在紧迫，不能详述。

detailed_translations.english: to enlarge (on a theme, topic, etc) at length or in detail; elaborate (on)

name: inspiriting
trans: adj. 振奋人心的

name: paroxysm
trans: n. （疾病周期性）发作；突发

sentences.english: He exploded in a paroxysm of rage.
sentences.chinese: 他突然勃然大怒。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden expression of strong feeling that you cannot control

name: plaintive
trans: adj. 哀伤的；悲哀的

sentences.english: They lay on the firm sands, listening to the plaintive cry of the seagulls.
sentences.chinese: 他们躺在坚实的沙滩上，听着海鸥的哀鸣。

detailed_translations.english: a plaintive sound is high, like someone crying, and sounds sad

name: cheek
trans: n. 面颊，脸颊；臀部 vt. 无礼地向…讲话，对…大胆无礼 n. (Cheek)人名；(英)奇克

sentences.english: Lucy stretched up to kiss his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 露西伸长了脖子去亲吻他的脸颊。

sentences.english: Billy had rosy cheeks and blue eyes.
sentences.chinese: 比利脸颊红润，长着一双蓝眼睛。

sentences.english: her tear-stained cheeks
sentences.chinese: 她泪痕斑斑的脸颊

sentences.english: Julie’s cheeks flushed with pleasure at the compliment.
sentences.chinese: 听了这赞美的话，朱莉开心得满脸通红。

detailed_translations.english: the soft round part of your face below each of your eyes

detailed_translations.chinese: 无礼地向…讲话，对…大胆无礼
detailed_translations.english: to speak rudely or with disrespect to someone, especially to someone older such as your teacher or parents

name: impertinence
trans: n. 鲁莽，无理；不恰当

sentences.english: He was punished for his impertinence.
sentences.chinese: 他为自己的粗鲁无礼遭到了惩罚。

detailed_translations.english: If someone talks or behaves in a rather impolite and disrespectful way, you can call this behaviour impertinence or an impertinence

name: incorrigible
trans: adj. 不可救药的；积习难改的 n. 不可救药的人

sentences.english: "Sunita, you are incorrigible!" he said.
sentences.chinese: “苏尼塔，你真是屡教不改啊！”，他说道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可救药的；积习难改的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is incorrigible is bad in a way that cannot be changed or improved – often used humorously

name: magistrate
trans: n. 地方法官；文职官员；治安推事

sentences.english: She will face a local magistrate on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 她将在星期二面见一位地方治安法官。

detailed_translations.english: someone, not usually a lawyer, who works as a judge in a local court of law, dealing with less serious crimes

name: august
trans: adj. 威严的；令人敬畏的 n. (August) 八月 n. (August) （美）奥古斯特（人名）

sentences.english: an august institution
sentences.chinese: 庄严的机构

detailed_translations.english: impressive and respected

name: capricious
trans: adj. 反复无常的；任性的

sentences.english: She was as capricious as her mother had been.
sentences.chinese: 她和她母亲当初一样反复无常。

detailed_translations.english: likely to change your mind suddenly or behave in an unexpected way

name: runnel
trans: n. 小河；沟渠

name: smote
trans: v. 打；重击；击败；侵袭（smite的过去式）

name: solemn
trans: adj. 庄严的，严肃的；隆重的，郑重的

sentences.english: a solemn expression
sentences.chinese: 严肃的表情

sentences.english: Their faces suddenly grew solemn.
sentences.chinese: 他们的脸突然变得严肃起来。

sentences.english: a solemn procession of mourners
sentences.chinese: 庄重的送葬队伍

sentences.english: solemn ritual/ceremony
sentences.chinese: 隆重的仪式/典礼

detailed_translations.chinese: 严肃的，庄重的；庄严的,隆重的
detailed_translations.english: very serious and not happy, for example because something bad has happened or because you are at an important occasion

name: sward
trans: n. 草地；草皮 vt. 给…铺上草皮 vi. 成为草地

name: artifice
trans: n. 诡计；欺骗；巧妙的办法 n. (Artifice)人名；(葡)阿蒂菲塞

sentences.english: Weegee's photographs are full of artfulness, and artifice.
sentences.chinese: 维加的照片充满了奇技妙想。

detailed_translations.english: a trick used to deceive someone

name: audacious
trans: adj. 无畏的；鲁莽的

sentences.english: the risks involved in such an audacious operation
sentences.chinese: 如此大胆的行动中存在的风险

detailed_translations.chinese: 厚颜无耻的；大胆鲁莽的
detailed_translations.english: showing great courage or confidence in a way that is impressive or slightly shocking

name: lamentation
trans: n. 悲痛，悲叹

name: languish
trans: vi. 憔悴；凋萎；失去活力；苦思

sentences.english: The housing market continues to languish.
sentences.chinese: 住宅市场继续疲软。

sentences.english: The shares are languishing at just 46p after yesterday’s fall.
sentences.chinese: 股价经历了昨天的下跌后，就停滞在46便士上了。

sentences.english: West Ham United are currently languishing at the bottom of the league.
sentences.chinese: 西汉姆联队目前在联赛中一直排名垫底。

detailed_translations.english: ifsomething languishes, it fails to improve and develop or become successful

name: sanguine
trans: adj. 乐观的；满怀希望的；面色红润的 vt. 血染；以血沾污 n. 血红色

sentences.english: a sanguine view
sentences.chinese: 乐观的态度

detailed_translations.chinese: 乐观的；满怀希望的；面色红润的
detailed_translations.english: happy and hopeful about the future

name: peremptory
trans: adj. 强制的；绝对的；断然的；专横的

sentences.english: a peremptory demand for silence
sentences.chinese: 要人肃静的蛮横要求

detailed_translations.chinese: 强制的；绝对的；断然的；专横的
detailed_translations.english: peremptory behaviour, speech etc is not polite or friendly and shows that the person speaking expects to be obeyed immediately

name: premonition
trans: n. （尤指不祥的）预感

sentences.english: He had an unshakable premonition that he would die.
sentences.chinese: 他有一种强烈的预感：他就要死了。

detailed_translations.english: a strange feeling that something, especially something bad, is going to happen

name: querulous
trans: adj. 易怒的，暴躁的；爱发牢骚的，抱怨的；爱挑剔的

sentences.english: ‘But why can’t I go?’ he said in a querulous voice.
sentences.chinese: “可是为什么我不能去呢？”他抱怨道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易怒的，暴躁的；爱发牢骚的，抱怨的；爱挑剔的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is querulous complains about things in an annoying way

name: reminiscence
trans: n. 回忆；怀旧；引起联想的相似事物

detailed_translations.chinese: 回忆；怀旧；引起联想的相似事物
detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written story about events that you remember

name: wayfarer
trans: n. 旅人，徒步旅行者

name: extinct
trans: adj. 灭绝的，绝种的；熄灭的 vt. 使熄灭

sentences.english: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙已灭绝数千万年了。

sentences.english: Pandas could become extinct in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 熊猫在野生环境中可能会绝种。

sentences.english: an extinct species
sentences.chinese: 已灭绝的一个物种

detailed_translations.english: (of a type of plant, animal, etc.) no longer in existence

name: humane
trans: adj. 仁慈的，人道的；高尚的

sentences.english: the campaign for the humane treatment of criminals
sentences.chinese: 提倡人道地对待罪犯的运动

sentences.english: a better, more humane world
sentences.chinese: 更美好、更人道的社会

detailed_translations.english: treating people or animals in a way that is not cruel and causes them as little suffering as possible

name: internship
trans: n. 实习生；（美）实习期；实习医师职位

sentences.english: ...an internship in surgery in New York.
sentences.chinese: …一个在纽约做外科实习的职位。

detailed_translations.english: a job that lasts for a short time, that someone, especially a student, does in order to gain experience

name: specimen
trans: n. 样品，样本；标本

sentences.english: a blood specimen
sentences.chinese: 血样

detailed_translations.english: a small amount or piece that is taken from something, so that it can be tested or examined
